title: Serif font — Markus
content:

wondering what this font is called?  
Thanks in advance!

 Dear Sir / Madam 

Solved By: 

 [akira1975](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133503/http:/typophile.com/user/4504 "View user profile.")
author: Emma-L

comments.content: Well to be honest, it is called Gill Facia. Radim Pesko just stole it.

Apparent source used to make the font.  
Eric Gill's Facia, designed for signwriters at W H Smith & Sons shops circa 1925.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FaciaEricGill4WHSmithAndSons1925ca3sm_5639.jpg)
  
Don

Also Colin Banks made a typeface for Monotype with the name Gill Facia. [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/gill-facia-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133503/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/gill-facia-mt/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/gill-facia-mt/")  
Don

Also see this tweet by Florian:  
 [https://twitter.com/hardwig/status/520285010629505024](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133503/https:/twitter.com/hardwig/status/520285010629505024 "https://twitter.com/hardwig/status/520285010629505024")  
_@typographica It appears to be based not on Gill Facia, but rather this signwriting guide → [http://typophile.com/node/100875#comment-544834](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133503/http:/typophile.com/node/100875#comment-544834 "http://typophile.com/node/100875#comment-544834") … Still should credit Gill._
Florian is very diplomatic. I’d rather see Pesko draw something original for once.

From the link in Florian's tweet, another digital interpretation: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/smith-hands/english-engravers-roman/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317133503/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/smith-hands/english-engravers-roman/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/smith-hands/english-engravers-roman/")

I see we are covering ground that is already well traveled. I prefer the original lettering to any of the interpretations. More fluid and inviting.  
Correct an error in my earlier post. Should be 1905 not 1925.  
Don
